intro: Parietaria punctata, commonly known as the common wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in urban areas, and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, dry pods. Parietaria punctata is also known for its ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
